c74object.name: partconvolve~
c74object.description: partconvolve~ copies samples from a buffer to use as a impulse response for FFT-based partitioned convolution. It can also be used to perform a simple static FFT-based FIR filter on an incoming signal. Typically partconvolve~ might be used in conjuction with timeconvolve~ for zero-latency convolution with longer impulses. The two objects have similar attributes / arguments and can be easily combined to design custom partitioning schemes.

objarg.name: Impulse_length
objarg.description:
Set the maximum impulse length in samples.
The defualt length is 1323000 samples (30 seconds at 44.1kHz)

objarg.name: Max_FFT_size
objarg.description:
Set the maximum FFT size as a power of 2.
The defualt size is 65536.
The absolute maximum is 1048576.

method.name: signal
method.digest: The signal to apply convolution to.
method.description: The signal to apply convolution to.

method.name: memoryusage
method.digest: report memory usage to the max window.
method.description: The memoryusage reports memory usage to the max window.

method.name: set
method.digest: set the buffer from which to fetch the impulse
method.description:
Set the buffer from which to fetch the impulse.
The message should be formatted as:
set / impulse buffer
The IO latency in this mode is half of the fft size.

method.name: eq
method.digest: set the buffer from which to fetch the eq
method.description:
Set the buffer from which to fetch the eq.
In EQ mode the object acts as a simple FFT-based FIR filter of the given fft size. The buffer should contain N / 2 points, which determine the frequency response of the filter.
The message should be formatted as:
set / eq buffer
The latency in this mode is the fft size.

method.name: direct
method.description: The direct mode is an experimental mode that expects the buffer to contain calculated and scaled fft data for the correct size of fft stored by frame, first real points (N / 2 + 1 points) and then imaginary data ( N / 2 - 1 points) for each frame in turn. This mode is not advised for general use, and you should proceed with caution (although it should not crash). There is no further documentation at this time on this mode.

attribute.name: fftsize
attribute.description:
Set the fft size for partconvolve~. It should be a power of 2 between a minumum of 32 and the max fft size.
The default is the max fft size.

attribute.name: offset
attribute.digest: Set the sample in the buffer from which to start
attribute.description:
Set the offset in samples from which to start processing the buffer.
The default is 0.

attribute.name: length
attribute.digest: Set the length in samples of the buffer.
attribute.description:
Set the length in samples of the buffer from the offset sample.
The default is 0, which is the whole rest of the buffer from the offset sample.

attribute.name: chan
attribute.digest: Set the channel in the buffer to use.
attribute.description:
Set the channel in the buffer to use.
The default is 1.

entry.name: signal
entry.description: The output is the input signal with the convolution applied to it.
